website_summaries.verdict: If you like the idea of a sturdy work bench that you can assemble to fit your needs, this is an affordable option.
pros: Features a customizable design that you can build in various configurations with work surfaces and shelves
Easy to assemble, and sturdy when put together
Price falls on the lower end of the scale
cons: May not appeal to those who want a basic or straightforward design
Some reports of screws and holes not matching up, requiring drilling

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bench!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! As a female I was a little worried about building my own gunsmithing bench, but this kit made it a breeze! Took me a few days, but I'm extremely happy with the results. I bought an extra set of shelf links to make the side shelves. Final product is super strong and solid!! So glad I bought this, and so is my kitchen table! :)
customer_reviews.author: K9 Malinois Momma

customer_reviews.title: New bike shop work bench, A++++
customer_reviews.text: I was able to buy the lumber, cut and build this in about 3-4 hours. I spent the rest of the weekend staining and wiring in lights. I am very impressed with the results, very easy and simple build. This is my new workbench for my bike shop, now I am ready to replace the old benches in my garage with this system. Super sturdy, just a great product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: slapmackie

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it's a trap I beleive
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this "workbench" thinking that it would be a great begging workbench for the price. Turns out its just the legs so the only thing your getting is tbe black pieces. This entire things shows u this workbench and how it cam be done different ways. However there is just one little spot that says lumber not included. Dont waste your money if u think you need these legs just go get some lumber from lowes
customer_reviews.author: Brandon O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Neat concept but if you're going to the trouble to get all these boards and planks cut you might as well just get some brackets and do the whole job. After adding up the cost of brackets and hardware I decided to do my own full build. I am not a builder and have about zero crafting experience but was able to make a custom desk pretty easily. One thing I wasn't crazy about is that only the width and length of the desk is really adjustable. You're stuck at the fixed height unless you do a workaround.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workbench.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic workbench. It's great for fitting a bench to your exact space. For my bench I used 2x6's across the top in order to get a little more height as well as to allow for an overhang that I can use a clamp on. This thing is very sturdy. I chose to use my Kreg Jig to make pocket holes for screwing the table top down rather than driving screws through the top. I also chose to put 3 coats of urethane on the top for more durability.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product it is not labeled correctly
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe it doesn’t include lumber. I bought this because I needed a work bench not a bunch of plastic. You should put it at the very top doesn’t include lumber not at the bottom hidden away. Returning this immediately and reporting the listing to amazon. Very misleading to have a photo of a product with lumber when you don’t include lumber.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Very much worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to add a work and storage area in my garage and after finding this kit online I felt like it was worth a try. I'm very happy with my purchase and the results of my project. I even found some good info online on how to modify the project to fit my needs. It's a very forgiving kit for the beginning/medium builder like myself which gave me confidence to get things done quickly and correctly and all without anyone helping. As long as you take your time and double check your measurements before making cuts you can get the professional looking results that you want.
customer_reviews.author: B.E.B.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic & Wood
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like that the consumer has to go out & get the wood described in the direction specification. This doesn’t make sense. The legs or sides are all plastic & this company wants you to attach wood to these plastic legs. If I knew that, I would not have bought this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Veronics Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Frame only! No wood included.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions not clear on plywood thickness AND the package is only the frame. You have to buy the wood! I'm a single grandma, I need it complete! I can't build or cut wood aND can't afgor to hire someone to put this together.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great customizeable workbench kit!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect kit to build a workbench to custom dimensions without too much difficulty. I constructed my bench out of white pine 2x4's and plywood. I reinforced the tabletops by running an additional 2x4 diagonally underneath in addition the the rectangle frame. I used wood glue and finishing nails. After staining the bench I applied 2 coats of Minwax polyurethane sealant. I'm a big guy, and this bench doesn't even flex when I stand on top of it. It's been over a year and has had no durability issues. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B.

customer_reviews.title: Can't really be called a kit missing items
customer_reviews.text: Just got my "kit" and already missing quite a few items. "What's in the Box Four workbench legs, six Shelf Links, assembly instructions, hardware, and warranty information." is what it clearly states comes with the kit. Upon opening the box, the hardware, assembly instructions and warranty information is all missing. 2 out of 5 items just doesn't work. One of the legs has a corner chipped off as well. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ciano Devela

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Loved not having to miter corners. I also liked that I could make it the size I wanted to so I fit it where I wanted to put it. The completed assembly feels solid and I went the whole 8' across. Now be aware the kit is relatively inexpensive, but if you go with 3/4" plywood shelves and you buy all the plywood for the main table and the shelving kit, you're investing another $150 in materials.
customer_reviews.author: Son of Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Missing necessary holes, AGAIN & AGAIN,3 Times!!
customer_reviews.text: I returned the 1st defective set,undrilled holes. This replacement also arrived defective. Multiple holes simply weren't drilled. Didn't bother counting this time. Also had big melted areas of legs. Not acceptable. Quality control? Update: 2nd set as bad as 1st. 2nd update: Now,I just had to return 3rd set. Same issue. Undrilled holes. I thought this was a good product but it seems "2×4 Basics" decided to forget about any qc and just ship out everything,defective or not.
customer_reviews.author: B Willie

customer_reviews.title: Good plastic, but horrible hardware!
customer_reviews.text: Having used other brackets - I DID appreciate the simplicity of this design. However, the hardware supplied is absolutely crap. First, they are labeled wrong. They are listed in he lacking materials and instructions as 3" screws. They are not. At least in my package- the screws with 2". But the bigger issue is the quality. They were cheap and the heads were too small. After trying 1 screw, I immediately tossed the ones included and used quality 2.5" deck screws.
customer_reviews.author: PL from NC

customer_reviews.title: EZPZ!
customer_reviews.text: figure out what size you want to build it and straight cut away! was a breeze to put together. add 3" to your depth in this case my depth cuts were 30" and the bench came out to 33" from the wall out. my framing cuts for the bench was 30D" and 48W". My top shelf cuts are 28". Overall: 6 cuts @ 48", 6 cuts @ 30", 4 cuts @ 28" 1 sheet of MDF was used for the bench and bottom shelves top shelves took 2'7"x4' total so one and a half sheets MDF will do the job to build to my specs. hope it helps ya!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Very good product overall
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit. Instructions page could be a bit more robust and clearly illustrated. Some of the pictures were a bit hard to interpret Do yourself a favor, take a drill bit and check all the “predrilled holes” before you attempt assembly. When I decided what size I wanted, I had HomeDepot precut the plywood. I sanded the plywood edges before assembly.And I had them preselect about 20 2x4s... needed about 7 for this project, and the rest will go towards the shelf unit system (next project) Despite my best efforts, the table seemed just a bit off being exactly squared, when I tried to get the top panel installed. A rubber mallet is a good addition to the tool list.
customer_reviews.author: Blu Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Insanely brilliant product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely brilliant. We used these to build two 32”x96” electronics workbenches for our workshop. They’re perfectly level and super sturdy. Even with nice birch ply tops we spent maybe $500 TOTAL to build 16 feet of 32” deep workbench. Incredibly sturdy legs and the versatility is only limited by your imagination. One gripe - I wish they came with 2 extra shelf links for a total of 8. It would have been nice to be able to make the 2-shelf version in the photo with them and not need to notch out the middle shelf. Come out with a desk-height version, please!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DEREK

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: It's not workbench like the title says. It's not workbench like the image shows. It's legs for DIY project but the title and the image don't say that.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Martynenko

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and economical solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good system for building a workbench, and relatively easy to assemble as long as you read the directions ahead of time and keep things straight. One thing to note: not all of the pre-drilled holes in the legs are clear or ready to use, they are partially or completely plugged and need to be drilled out. Also, you might want to use additional screws above what is provided to ensure good solid connections, especially if your bench will be used heavily. I increased the amount of sub-frame support for the bench top to maximize its load support capability (see picture). All in all, a good system; I'm super pleased with the end result.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Fox

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build, and cheaper than premade workbenches.
customer_reviews.text: Other than initally starting out, it was easy enough to do single handed. I like how customizable this is and how this allows me to make a behemoth of a workbench for cheaper than what a much smaller workbench would have cost me. I also was not very careful in my measurements and have a lot of left over wood. I made the middle shelf planks removable, so if I want to put something tall under there, I can. I am also missing a 2x4 on the upper section. Somehow I got home from lowes 1 short, but thats my fault not thiers. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: madie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the very reasonable price, very solid once secured in place
customer_reviews.text: Great easy kit to put together. Very sturdy and versatile to make your bench any size, especially for my reloading station. I used pressure treated 2×4s and urethaned them even with it as an inside bench. 1x6 pine for the shelves and topped off with 2 sheets of 1/2 inch PT plywood and found an awesome deal on a bar counter top. Apocolypse proof. Can't wait to finish it over the next couple days.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan & Teresa B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a pretty outstanding kit. One note is that it is a heck of alot easier to square up the corners if you have someone to help if you go a full 8 feet on the length. I would also use 2x4s or something similar for the shelflink top. I went with the cull 3/4 inch OSB I had from the table top and it sags a little bit with the weight of all the stuff I have up there. Easy to use and perfect for novices to amateurs to the lazy b*stard who didn't feel like dealing with making his own legs
customer_reviews.author: Shawn C. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and easy, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I used this to build a small workbench to keep some tools indoors. In this particular instance you may tell I am not using it to hold heavy items on the top shelf, as the TV is doubling as a support. I could easily see myself purchasing this product again to add a second larger bench for more sizable projects. Comes with all required fasteners. DOES NOT COME WITH WOOD. I think the product description makes it clear - but just to make sure folks know! The build up process is quick compared to starting from scratch. I believe it took me 2-3 hours or so to put it together including wood cuts and measuring, and adding the pegboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mats

customer_reviews.title: Ad is misleading.
customer_reviews.text: I would’ve had to buy the shelving separately The description does not mention that.
customer_reviews.author: Lin D

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty sturdy workbench, very affordable
customer_reviews.text: I needed a workbench for my retirement home garage but wad disappointed in the prices for premanufactured ready to assemble units available in hardware stores or on line. I found this kit on Amazon and being a advanced amateur handyman type decided to buy and built myself. All the necessary screws, instructions, and frame pieces came supplied. All I needed to do is buy the wood from Home Depot which cost me rounded $ 80. Instructions were easy to follow. I took pictures of the build process to show how easy it was to put together. Looks great in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Nolting

customer_reviews.title: No shelves.  Frame only.
customer_reviews.text: I missed the description piece about needing your own wood to make the shelves. Not fir me!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a solid bench to use for reloading. Many I looked at did not seem solid or were pricey. This is ONLY the supports, not the wood. But that allows you to make it as strong and as rugged as you need. Also, you can use cheaper lumber for a less costly project if you don't need a fine grain, high quality finish.
customer_reviews.author: M. Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Easy stable and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much time or money I got in this Figured it’s the only time I’m gonna build a work bench so I wanted it to look good Used upgraded lumber and stain And rented a cordless nailer from Home Depot for $39 Stain all around Not Sure if I will add Shelves Vice Lights Wheels Pegboard Anyway I’m done with phase 1 Really easy to assemble And very stable and versatile
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Great product, solid quality and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for his birthday because I was tired of not being able to get into my outdoor freezer because he would put stuff on it. Stuff I couldn’t lift especially holding a baby. And all I wanted was to take out some beef for dinner. He loves it. It works for what he needs AND AND the extra stuff doesn’t get put on my damn freezer! I’m allowed to cook dinner again! But seriously, it’s a solid piece worth the price. It’s not flimsy like you’re afraid a butterfly is going to land on it and it’s going to collapse. And I believe it will last a longggg time.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. I just bought a house and have started building a workshop. I needed a large bench and these were great, just had to buy the wood which is much cheaper than buying a pre-assembled bench. Lot's of ways to build the benches as other photos have shown. I decided to use the smaller shelf piece to make 2 small tables for around the workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Jforts

customer_reviews.title: Would Use Anything Else.
customer_reviews.text: Love this kit. I was able to choose my own materials and create the exact size of bench needed. Even though I assembled the benches myself, I would recommend having another person help hold the pieces in place while you assemble. I used 3/4" plywood for work top and bottom shelving. It makes the bench extra sturdy. I drilled pilot holes into the bracing and replaced the screws provided with heavy duty deck screws. I weigh over 200 pounds and can stand on these without it moving an inch. These run up the middle of one of my garage bays so I hung pegboard on the back and store my gardening tools there.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a workbench
customer_reviews.text: Hubby bought this for himself and he's delighted with the versatility and quality. He now has a proper BIG work bench! Let the DIY projects continue in a more organized manner! :) Very sturdy, easy to handle, easy to configure into different setups. He put rolling caster wheels on the bottom of the legs, so it's easy to move to clean under and around, and also to work on things from different angles if needed.
customer_reviews.author: TZ2DSR

customer_reviews.title: This is an “okay” workbench
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these workbenches, they have been “satisfactory” usually. My preference is to build them without the middle shelf (one good shelf is better than two that are too short). But, the bench loses substantial structural integrity when built without the middle shelf. I had a 150 lb toolbox on one end of a bench and the plastic leg started bowing outward under the stress, which gave me a lot of concern.
customer_reviews.author: ericsmithcpa

customer_reviews.title: Great bench kit! Very versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bench kit! I went with 8ft length x 42” wide for a reloading bench, I built one y’all shelf along the back, and used slat wall for the back of the shelf. I took the remaining shelf brackets and built a small bench that attaches to the side and built a bunch of cubby style shelves to store items such as primers, powder, and bullets. I will post pics of the finished product after I’m done sealing & sanding.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy build, no rot or rust legs.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the legs are a composite that won’t rust or rot. As I put this on an outdoor shed, prior work tables legs have rusted or rotted. There is some of an issue with driving the screws too deep and them pulling right thru the leg hole. You then have to put a washer over the screw to get it to hold in the leg. Make sure you set your drill clutch low to start out or you will have this problem!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workbench!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the workbench. Incredibly sturdy, easy to build. I love how customizable this can be, though the primary thing I cared about was depth and length (2 ft deep, 7 ft long). I'm less thrilled with the shelf links. I think it would be just as easy (maybe easier) to just work with 2X4s rather than bother with the link system. Additionally, I would have liked having about 1.5 more depth...but this system is not customizable in that way.
customer_reviews.author: the frenchman

customer_reviews.title: A few hacks to improve table performance
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to build a versatile work table. I made a few structural changes. After putting the table together the top was not perfectly flat. Rather than using a diagonal brace per the instructions I put in three cross braces with pocket screws to get a much flatter table top. I also added a 2x4 to double the width of the front rail as this makes it far easier to secure a bar clamp to hold workpieces. The added surface area will be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome concept
customer_reviews.text: This was my first real furniture building project and this kit set me up for success! I went to Home Depot to get the 2X4s and had them cut it to size. Once I got home it took me under an hour to put it all together, including the 2 shelves. The thing is as sturdy as they get. It's a great height so that you can work standing up without killing your back! Great!
customer_reviews.author: Dov C.

customer_reviews.title: Bench for life
customer_reviews.text: I got this over a year ago and finally just put it together, less the top. It is a super sturdy bench if assembled correctly. You could probably rest a small car on it. It is awkward to assemble alone though. I did and I recommend an extra set of hands to set the bottom and top rails and use a speed square. If you get that right it will be perfect. Mine is a little off kilt but not really noticeable. I also modified mine with a cut out for my legs when sitting. All in, the project probably cost about $150. Worth it for a super sturdy forever bench.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Great product to build a working table
customer_reviews.text: These are the great product, very sturdy and easy to install especially made in USA (that I don't see for a long time) I don't mind to pay more for USA product Only one thing that I wish they paint or make some other colors (like grey, dark grey etc...) so I don't need to paint them with primer cans The best product. I have ordered 3 sets and will order more......
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble, tons of possibilities
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased several of these for my workshop. I was working with some odd space constraints and these definitely fit the bill. I was able to maximize all the space in my garage. After that my son needed a workbench for his space so I custom built him a dodgers bench. Then my wife wanted a shoe rack/bench and I had extra shelve pieces so I made her what she wanted. These are fast easy to do and tons of fun to get creative with.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Z

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to put together!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this kit, it made building a workbench very fast and easy! After buying materials (2x4's, plywood and deck screws) I had my bench completed in about an hour and a half. I took my measurements and had Lowe's cut everything to size, so putting it together at home was a snap. There's is absolutely no wobble and it's very sturdy and strong. I highly recommend this kit!
customer_reviews.author: DaveF

customer_reviews.title: I stained and finished my and in total it probably took me more like 8-10 hours to complete
customer_reviews.text: The product does make it slightly easier to build a work bench. I have a lot of carpentry experience and I don't see how anyone could assemble this in an hour. I stained and finished my and in total it probably took me more like 8-10 hours to complete... granted, I built a workbench that would cost $2k for about $400 so that is good. I have to say that these are totally unnecessary and anyone with the ability to to cut the 2x4s to make this could also make it without them by just cutting a few more boards or using 4x4s for the legs.
customer_reviews.author: OneJazzyMomma

customer_reviews.title: What everyone else is saying
customer_reviews.text: What everyone else is saying. I built my dream workbench in a day, at a fraction of the price of building from scratch, many if my friends who've seen it have bought their own, and my bench is strong as a tank. I added casters to the 4 corners by adding cut pieces of 2x4 to beef up the support rails and my legs are now basically suspended, but strength is unaffected and now I can roll my bench around the shop. I would feel comfortable building a motor on this things it's so tuff. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Anarcho_Moto

customer_reviews.title: VERY HEAVY DUTY IN PERSON
customer_reviews.text: These are MUCH more heavy duty in person than they appear in the photos. I thought they seemed somewhat overpriced - UNTIL I received them. YES... these ARE worth the money... I would order these without hesitation. PS: I'm just a regular Amazon customer. I was NOT paid to write this and I did NOT get a discount for a review.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome work bench!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best items I have ordered so far. It was easy and fun to assemble. I was able to make it “my own”. So many ways you can put this together. I was able to assemble it exactly the way I want it. It’s going to be my gun work station. My wife is so happy that I have finally consolidated all my “gun stuff” to the same space. Love it. Gun cleaning and assembling is about to be even more fun. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid work bench
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome product. Yes you could make this in all 2x4 but this composite plastic is like the plastic used in lower receivers on guns. It makes the build nice and sturdy. I only used the instructions as a guide and made my own plan. It is 3’x8’. Easy to use and better than building it all by 2x4. Mine is 3’Dx8’W. I built it by myself. I used 14 2x4x8, 3 2x4x10, and 3 sheets of ply wood. I was short 1 2x4x8. I spent about $150 in wood. I used the screws that came w it. It’s easily customizable.
customer_reviews.author: Buckshot

customer_reviews.title: Had to take apart and start over.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a really sturdy bench, so easy to put together you get going and forget that unless you miter your corners together, your looking at an additional two inches of depth to your planned dimensions, had it framed except for the plywood (thankfully) and discovered this, had to remove the screws holding in four pieces of 2x4 and take off four inches each. In summary, you want 24” finished depth for your table? Cut your side 2x4’s to 20”, or use them skills (and a chopsaw) to miter your corners. Don’t be me.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Brown

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product...
customer_reviews.text: This DIY style workbench is Awesome! It is sturdy and gives you so many options in creating a custom workbench. I was able to make a workbench that was well suited for my X-Carve CNC Setup, allowing me to be more productive and have an efficient layout with plenty of storage for material. I love it so much, I've bought a second one to help organize the layout of my workshop, and free up room.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas J.

customer_reviews.title: Makes building a work Bench easy !!
customer_reviews.text: I figured the size of the bench I wanted (8ft long by 32” deep), calculated how many 2x4’s and other materials I needed and ordered them from Home Depot for delivery. The kit came on Wednesday and the wood Friday. By noon Saturday I had a finished work bench and I’m a terrible carpenter ........ love the 2x4 basics kit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cambron

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for the DIY person with an imagination
customer_reviews.text: After looking at all the prefabricated ones I decided to try out this kit because it gave me the freedom to make it the way I wanted to. Instead of building the frame as their directions indicated it seemed better to put the main shelves together first. I put the 1 inch plywood inside of the 2 x 4 forms first using both screws and wood glue. then I put one on its side and then added it to the lower part of 2 legs, flipped it over added the other two legs. Then I put it into the standing position and simply dropped in the top shelf. Then added the upper smaller shelf.
customer_reviews.author: E Art Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Incredible customer service
customer_reviews.text: First review I have ever done but the excellent customer service demands I must. The workbench is easy to put together, sturdy. I bought 2.5 inch exterior star screws as others have suggested. I put together the bases first then attached the legs. On the third leg I noticed a piece of the leg was cracked along one of the screw holes. Oh no!! Visions of having to take everting apart, package, return everything to remedy situation. There was a toll free number to the company on the directions. I called and within 2 minutes the customer service rep said she would mail a replacement leg!! No questions asked. When does that happen these days. Incredible. Thank you Hopkins!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a gift and he L O V E D it. He could not find a work bench that had the dimensions/specs he wanted, so he built one himself with this system. He works ROUGH, and this has held up really well with the beatings its taken in a short time already. Very happy with this product, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bench legs! Very sturdy, impervious to surface moisture. Easy to assemble with two people with very good instruction. Of course I read them after I was halfway done building the shelf frames and realized I didnt have to do it that way. I finished doing it that way anyway cause I had already started and that's just what we do! I recommend getting some 3" 2quare drive screws and ditch the ones supplied. They CAN be used.. But as they are phillips, they can slip and strip at the slightest hesitation. Save yourself the headache and get square drive screws. You will LOVE these legs!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for the DIY
customer_reviews.text: Great for the DIY! I'm happy with the product, it's a nice starting point for getting your workbench project up and going. Easy to adjust and modify for different configurations. It's only limited by your imagination (and budget) as to how simple or complex you want your setup. Note: wood is NOT supplied with this product. I recommend fully.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M.

customer_reviews.title: Simple sturdy Build That’s customizable
customer_reviews.text: I’m the kid who cut his finger in shop class - and even I could build a high quality work bench with this set!!! Simple instructions which give you plenty of size options. Easy afternoon built that you can customize to your liking. Well worth the cost! Great website with ideas for builds as well.
customer_reviews.author: Will H

customer_reviews.title: Great Workbench and Shelving Unit Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome kit for making your own workbench. I was looking for a custom width workbench to fit in a space in my garage. Other pre-made benches were either too short or too long. Putting the bench and shelving unit together was pretty straightforward. The instructions are actually useful.I purchased the lumber from Home Depot and had them cut it to size. They will charge a bit extra for this service but for me it was worth it. I used a polyurethane finish on the plywood work surface to make it a bit more durable. The project took a couple of hours to complete including treating the plywood surfaces. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindal Costumer

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for that section in your basement or garage where ...
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for that section in your basement or garage where you want a sturdy workbench but can't find one the right size. The key is to try to cut all of the lumber at once. I am a novice and the hardest part was cutting all the wood exactly the same size. It went together quickly (probably would have been quicker with an electric drill) and is SO STURDY! I bought one to custom make a workbench with shelves for a gardening shed.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy work surface!
customer_reviews.text: While this project was easy to assemble, I gave it 4 stars for the “easy to assemble” rating, because the directions tell you to put the 2x4s on first and then the plywood (or whatever you are using for the top). It is impossible to put the plywood sections in when the 2x4s are in place. Build it from the bottom up for best results. We ended up having to take one of the legs off to put the plywood on. No big deal. It’s a sturdy work surface. We had the hardware store cut all the pieces to the size that we wanted and just had to put it all together.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Melito

customer_reviews.title: Quick, simple, and strong
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about these. I now have three and hope to get a fourth. Each time I need a new work surface, I consider building one from scratch, but the ease of assembly with these and the ability to change sizes with just a few screws makes these well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Very good set up
customer_reviews.text: MADE IN AMERICA! Great units, a little difficult to get it set up but worked great. (i recommend getting two people to hold the 2x4s while you screw gun them). Included screws are a tad cheap IMO, but I am the guy who will use deck screws to repair drywall! Very happy for the money
customer_reviews.author: xP.1337

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. A must buy for the DIY'er
customer_reviews.text: 2x4 basics really did a great job with this product. I was a little sceptical at first but it's awesome. One thing I did was make sure all of my cuts were consistent and to keep the bench square as I put it together. It helps to have 2 people but I built it all on my own with clamps. If I were to do it again I would cut all pieces first and then paint. I painted after it was all together and it wasn't all that bad but could have saved time painting first.
customer_reviews.author: deearrgh

customer_reviews.title: Great for work benches, wish it was sold without the shelf pieces though.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled two 2x8ft work benches with the legs for usage in the garage. Easy to assemble and holding up great to high humidity. Knocking off a start on the rating as there is no way to just purchase the legs. Sitting on two boxes worth of shelf attachments I will never use.
customer_reviews.author: Tangent

customer_reviews.title: WARNING
customer_reviews.text: Warning this is not a full table. It’s just the legs u have to get the wood to frame and build ur table.. I paid $52 for some table legs expecting a table. I hope u all read this b4 buying..
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am building an outdoor kitchen so I can socialize with my friends again at a safe distance. I scored a super cool but super heavy cast iron sink and was not confident that my basic carpentry skill would be enough to build a story enough counter for my new sink. I found this system, and within 2 hours I had an awesome and very sturdy counter. I am very pleased!! I also bought the shed kit. I can't wait to see what I create with that.
customer_reviews.author: Deann DaSilva

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great workbench
customer_reviews.text: I don't write long reviews. Once you cut the lumber to the right length, it all assembles pretty easily. I will add one piece of advice. On the bottom, I added some 2x4 blocks under the long rails for extra support. I used scrap pieces from the rails. This allows you to have heavy weight on the bottom shelf with no sagging. I did not use a middle shelf. This should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Pirie

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, I built my new workbench over two days. It would have gone far faster except that I stained all the wood before assembly. I built mine 8' x 3' and there is lots of room on the 2 shelves below the top. I also put a few coats of polyurethene on the top and the frame. Having an extra pair of hands is highly advisable, I also used better wood screws than were in the kit. I am going to build another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Pete H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Workbench to customize
customer_reviews.text: This kit is awesome! Very easy to modify and assemble. My bench is 84” long by 24” deep. I went to my local lumber yard to get better quality materials than Lowe’s or HD. All said and done, total time spent assembling was 4 hours. Paint was full day. Used 10 2x4s, 1 4x8 sheet of birch plywood, 1 1x6, and 1 1x12. Cost = $250 total. Awesome value!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: By staining that cheap fir framing lumber and not being ...
customer_reviews.text: By staining that cheap fir framing lumber and not being completely brain dead, even the least skilled human can make a half way decent workbench or in my case, a ammunition reloading bench. It helps a lot with having a very not level basement floor too.
customer_reviews.author: William Kelley

customer_reviews.title: It is nice in that anyone doesn't need to know about brackets ...
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the money-unless you don't know anything about carpentry... I bought this and assembled it quite quickly but then designed a far more stable bench without the jazzy plastic. It is nice in that anyone doesn't need to know about brackets or toe-nailing to assemble a fine large bench. Just be advised that what the picture shows is a 4x8 ft. surface. Quite huge compared to most benches. Just saying....
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very easy work table solution
customer_reviews.text: I've got some basic carpentry skills, but I didn't want to have to deal with designing and building a work table from scratch. This table system is customizable, easy to build, and honestly was probably not more expensive than if I built something completely out of lumber instead of this kit. This is my leather working table, and because it lives in my living room, I stained and finished all of the lumber as well because why not?
customer_reviews.author: Red Baron X

customer_reviews.title: Great price - Solid product!
customer_reviews.text: I built one of these in my home office this weekend and couldn't be happier! Makes a great work bench for hobbies and projects. I'm going to buy another one for my garage. These are very solid and would make a great work bench in the garage. Since you buy your own lumber, you get to decide the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: mjheed

customer_reviews.title: Shop table dreams.
customer_reviews.text: If you somewhat want to build a table, or if you don’t want to spend a bunch of money on a table this is for you. I spent half the price, made a bigger table, and it has a shelf the whole length of the table. Perfect for all my leather working needs.
customer_reviews.author: Haylee

customer_reviews.title: works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: no better way to build a work bench with almost no effort. you just can't mess it up. i wend with a 4' x 6' bench and had the plywood cut at home depot while i was there. after that was just a few simple cuts with a chop saw. took me longer to find the right lumber than it did to assemble the bench. good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Dapice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent start to your work bench/ desk!
customer_reviews.text: This product makes it so easy to make your own bench/ desk. It’s even easy for a beginner looking to get into do it yourself jobs. I even brought the measurements to Lowe’s and they cut all the pieces for $5. Just make sure you get your measurements right. As I made a few mistakes as I’m sure you can see in the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sturtevant

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic way to help frame a bench!
customer_reviews.text: These legs were absolutely fantastic, I managed to put this together in roughly 2.5 hours. I had a unique predicament where I was limited on space and needed something custom. I'm going to be burning and then coating in linseed oil to finish it. I'll be adding additional pictures when that is completed. I will also be adding the shelves and putting pegboard behind them, I cannot advocate how much I like these legs, the legs are the one thing I HATE dealing with.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Work bench and Shelves.
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, I bought all my supplies for it at the local Home Depot. It's very Sturdy, I used Oak Veneer for top, Minwax Prestain, Minwax natural 209, and Minwax helmsman spar urethane, Elmer's stain-able wood filler, Gorilla Construction adhesive and Spax Construction Screws, I used Diablo Sand paper, Rigid Worm Drive Saw, Ryobi jig Saw, Rigid Palm Sander,Rigid impact Driver. , I also have the Saw Horses.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana DIY

customer_reviews.title: Great Work table kit. Have two.
customer_reviews.text: I have put two of these tables together and they are damn strong. One is used for reloading and have my presses mounted on top. I added a shelf as well to hold all of my reloading manuals. The second is used for gunsmithing with a vise on top. On both I have installed a pegboard wall to hang tools and such. Easy to assemble as well, can’t go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mysfit

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful / beyond fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift from the least mechanically inclined person I know, my brother. He built a beautiful work bench. He was able to size it perfectly for his space. Some people just hard on stuff, and this thing can take. Spectacular product.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: The system works well for me. It's important to ...
customer_reviews.text: The system works well for me. It's important to remember that the parts are designed for finished 2x4s. I.E. the ones you get at Lowes or Home Depot that measure out to 3 1/2" x 1 5/8". Some reviews were critical of the fact that a real 2" x 4" won't fit. That is true, but most of us have never even seen a 2" x 4" "2x4". I built a work bench 16' long 40" high 24" deep with 2 layers of shelves on it using 3 kits.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G

customer_reviews.title: Great starting point for custom workbench!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a custom workbench solution to fit an awkward space in my garage. This kit allowed me to build an 8’x 24” counter height workbench that fits perfectly and is super sturdy!! The bench worked out so well that now my family is always using it and hanging out in MY garage. I customized mine adding fluorescent lighting, a power/surge strip under the front edge, spaces for my klipsch speakers, pegboard tool storage, and a nice thick top finished with a matte polyurethane.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Design Work/Potting Bench
customer_reviews.text: Designed to be flexible for any type of work table. We will use as a potting bench. The legs are made of heavy durable vinyl material suitable for indoor/outdoor use. Unique design includes hardware so one only needs to supply 2x4 lumber.
customer_reviews.author: Mikie

customer_reviews.title: The potting bench of my dreams.
customer_reviews.text: This spring we decided to invest in making our suburban garage the MOST functional it can be. We purchased two kits, one for a large woodworking/auto/moto bench and one for a potting bench. The surface is 4’ wide and 2’ deep. I didn’t need 16” deep shelves so we cut the shelf supports in half to make two shallow upper shelves for clay pots and baskets and one lower for plastic nursery pots that aren’t as pretty to look at. Plenty of room for soil underneath and everyone’s favorite part: the peg board. Your life will change for the better by building one of these, no matter what your hobby is. I guarantee it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: What is attached to the top right corner???  I like the workbench quite well.
customer_reviews.text: Can someone identify the part with the round knob hanging on the corners? See the circle center of my photo attached? I'd like to know where to get some. I'm really pleased with this easy to assemble workbench overall.
customer_reviews.author: TES

customer_reviews.title: Quick and dirty
customer_reviews.text: Found that my driver caused the screws to heat to the point where the plastic braces melted around the heads. Thus disassembly is a problem. Also the heads can strip so carefully select your driver head. Updated: The bottom portion continues to be rock steady and I have received a few complements on the unit. I will look for alternatives for the next house but if I were to pilot hole then use the hammer driver there should be less heat thus negating my compliant.
customer_reviews.author: TX Aggie PM

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THINK TWICE
customer_reviews.text: No shelving kit, no hardware, no instructions. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: HAROLD

customer_reviews.title: No shelves...only end pieces...buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the fact that this was only the legs...very misleading...too pricey for only legs...would not recommend to anyone for this price...maybe 40 bucks but certainly not 70.
customer_reviews.author: mwr

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench
customer_reviews.text: This is the 6th bench I have set up over the years using this product. Always come out perfect with a very stable bench. Last two I made were 8' long by 2' wide. Very sturdy. Makes nice shelves also.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V. Oconnell

customer_reviews.title: Build to your needs
customer_reviews.text: Having the ability to cut dimensional lumber and build the workbench as big or small as needed is a BIG plus. The corner legs are sturdy and the build goes quick if you have any experience, but should not take too long if this is a first time build. I built two 6' benchs with half(3') middle selves. finished the top with 3/4" 'white wood' and 3/4" plywood for middle and bottom shelf. i added a top shelf over one side and added 3" LED lighting. Very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Triconex

customer_reviews.title: Great for making a work bench with ease and so many ways to mod it.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. Built mine finally after having these for a few months. Took me about 14 2x4s to do it. If you Google 2x4 basics workbench you will see many pics of diff ways it can be assembled and ways people mod it.
customer_reviews.author: William Covey Jr

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I'm working on my THIRD bench project with this kit. Can't believe the negative reviews, not too bright if they can't read the features that CLEARLY state lumber is not included. Planning on another project soon for an outdoor bench using treated lumber and not using any plywood.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm happy. But the screws are not long enough to secure it.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy but the instructions should read as such. 1. Throw screws that came with product in trashcan 2. Go to the store and buy 2 and half inch screws
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kues

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY workbench!!
customer_reviews.text: I got a bit carried away using 3/4 plywood on top and shelves but this came together perfectly. I installed a set of 3" rubber wheels on the bottom cross beams and it is now an awesome "portable" work bench. Nice and heavy, I used 4x4's for the top frame so I could bolt down a bench grinder and vise. Also shortened the top shelves a bit as well as indenting the middle shelf on the bottom section.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good Design
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Easy to assemble—especially if you have a helper and good power tools. Smart design, down to the pocket screws that pull the 2x4s into place to prevent distortion. Not elegant, but very efficient and useful.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: After looking at the reviews I settled on a straight forward rolling workbench. It was extremely easy, I have pretty much no background in carpentry. Would do this again but want to build my own using my new table.
customer_reviews.author: Copperjohn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Easy Fast
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase. It was easy to assemble, it was fast and it is super sturdy. Great project. I love that you just customize everything to the site that you want / need
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This system was as easy as promised
customer_reviews.text: This system was as easy as promised. We bought this and a shelving set. I love that I didn't have to worry about being perfect with the cuts, and didn't have to cut angles.... just straight cuts on a 2 x 4. I was surprised that this was as easy as it was, definitely consistent with the reviews. I will definitely buy these systems again, and would recommend them to others as well.
customer_reviews.author: BlueUtah

customer_reviews.title: Liar,Liar
customer_reviews.text: Description says hardware included. Not so. No instructions and no screws! Had to drop everything, drive to town,buy screws. Want to fix this? Time, gas, $$$. Downloaded instructions but couldn't download screws🤔. If you want ant to fix this screw up think big!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca T.

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! Easy to put together and sturdy enough to make it into a reloading bench. I didn’t use the diagonal brace under the top piece of plywood but instead made more bracing to make it a little stiffer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Holes weren't drilled all the way through.
customer_reviews.text: There were some holes that weren't drilled all the way through. It was definitely more work than I expected, but easier than building a workbench without this product, for sure. The screws were the wrong size.....I got #10 1.5 inch. Overall, I'm very happy with the final product.
customer_reviews.author: Bess

product_meta.title: 2x4basics 90164 Custom Work Bench and Shelving Storage System, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:Original| Pattern Name:Work BenchThe Hopkins 90164 2x4basics Workbench and Shelving Storage System offers an easy fix to custom shelving. All the hardware is included, just add the size lumber you want (lumber not included). Simple assembly with only a powered screwdriver and a saw, no miter or angle cuts necessary. Ideal for the garage and shed, the Shelf Links are durable and sturdy giving you the ability to easily organize your items onto storage shelving.

AMAZON.COM
Create a work and storage space that truly fits your needs with the 2x4basics Workbench Assembly Kit. This innovative, do-it-yourself system lets you easily assemble a custom workbench in less than an hour. All you need is some plywood and 2x4s and you'll have a work bench that will meet all your project and storage requirements.





Use the included bonus ShelfLinks Kit
to add shelving to the top or sides 
of your workbench. View larger.2x4basics 
Workbench Assembly Kit
At a Glance * Helps you build a customized workbench with a height of 36 inches
 * 
 * Assembles in less than one hour
 * 
 * Each shelf holds up to 1,000 pounds (400 kilograms)
 * 
 * Requires only straight, 90-degree cuts 
 * 
 * Lifetime warranty


Completely Customizable, Easy-to-Assemble Workbench System
This do-it-yourself system lets you create a bench that's the exact size you want--up to 8 by 4 feet--by just adding lumber (not included). Assembly is incredibly easy, thanks to the included, easy-to-follow instructions and cut lists. All you need is a powered screwdriver and a saw--no other tools are necessary. For added convenience, only straight, 90-degree cuts are required--no miters or angles--and all the hardware you'll need is included in the kit. When assembly is completed, the work surface height will measure approximately 36 inches (90 centimeters).Advanced Engineering Meets Strong, Durable Construction
Sturdy 2x4 framing and advanced engineering make this kit stronger and more stable than most other workbench solutions. In fact, each shelf will hold up to 1,000 pounds (400 kilograms). An added bonus, the materials are made of heavy-gauge resins and are impact- and solvent-resistant for long-term durability.

Versatile Design for Potting Benches, Custom Shelving, and Storage Options
With the Workbench Assembly Kit, you are no longer limited to a standard-sized potting bench--you can make a unit as small as 2 feet by 2 feet to use as a plant stand.

In addition, you can use the included bonus 2x4basics ShelfLinks Kit to add shelving to the top or sides of your custom workbench (additional ShelfLinks kits sold separately). You can build custom workbench and storage solutions for your dorm room, garage, basement, shed, or home. Custom shelving will also add valuable storage space that fits your project requirements.

What's in the Box 
Four workbench legs, six ShelfLinks, assembly instructions, hardware, and warranty information.






Customize a work bench for any jobsite.
View larger.

Each shelf holds up to 1,000 pounds.
View larger.

Solvent resistant for long-term durability.
View larger.

Expand your shelving and storage with six included ShelfLinks. View larger.


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This do-it-yourself system lets you create a bench that's the exact size you want--up to 8 feet by 4 feet--by just adding lumber (lumber not included). Assembly is incredibly easy, thanks to the included, easy-to-follow instructions and cut lists. All you need is a powered screwdriver and a saw--no other tools are necessary. For added convenience, only straight, 90-degree cuts are required--no miters or angles--and all the hardware you'll need is included in the kit. When assembly is completed, the work surface height will measure approximately 36 inches (90 centimeters). Sturdy 2 by 4 framing and advanced engineering make this kit stronger and more stable than most other workbench solutions. Each shelf will hold up to 1,000 pounds (400 kilograms). An added bonus, the materials are made of heavy-gauge resins and are impact- and solvent-resistant for long-term durability.

See more
feature_bullets: Lumber not included with each kit (Shelves not included)
Brackets made of heavy gauge structural resin. Workbench Legs to make a workbench in any length or width up to 8 feet by 4 feet (2.4m x 1.2m)
Only straight 90 degree cuts, no miter or angle cuts necessary
